author: Rory Jones
title: Jerusalem’s Church of the Holy Sepulchre Closed Amid Dispute With Israelis - WSJ
text:
TEL AVIV—Christian leaders barred access to one of Jerusalem’s holiest sites in an ongoing dispute with Israeli authorities that underscores lingering tensions over a U.S. decision to recognize the city as Israel’s capital.
Clergymen made the rare decision Sunday to close the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, believed to mark the burial site of Jesus, to protest city taxes and a proposed Israeli parliamentary bill to confiscate land sold by church authorities. They said the church would be closed until further notice.
... RELATED VIDEO Pence: U.S. Embassy Will Move to Jerusalem in 2019 In a speech before Israel's legislature in late January, Vice President Mike Pence said the U.S. embassy will be moved from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem by the end of 2019, ahead of schedule. Photo: AP
